paper_abstract: We continue the study of the spiking neural P systems considered as transducers of binary strings or binary infinite sequences, and we investigate their ability to compute morphisms. The class of computed morphisms is rather restricted: length preserving or erasing, and the so-called 2-block morphisms can be computed; however, non-erasing non-length-preserving morphisms cannot be computed.
paper_title: Computing morphisms by spiking neural P systems
